required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of ACE-536 in Healthy Postmenopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamic Effects of ACE-536 in Healthy Postmenopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out whether ACE-536 can be safely given to patients. This study will also look to see if ACE-536 increases red blood cells, the cells that carry oxygen in the body.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Adverse Events as a measure of safety and tolerability.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACE-536 serum concentration after single and multiple ascending doses.
Hemoglobin levels after single and multiple ascending doses.

arm_group.description: Subjects assigned to 1 of 5 possible dosing groups.

intervention.description: Subjects receive a total of 2 subcutaneous doses of ACE-536 on Day 1 and Day 15.
Subjects receive a total of 2 subcutaneous doses of placebo on Day 1 and Day 15.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal women
- Body Mass Index (BMI) of 20 - 32 kg/m2.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hypertension
- Subject has received any erythropoiesis stimulating agents (e.g., Epogen, Procrit, Aranesp, etc.) within 6 months prior to Day 1
- History of clinically significant cardiac, endocrine, hematologic, hepatic, immune, metabolic, urologic, pulmonary, neurologic, dermatologic, psychiatric, renal, and/or other disease
- Surgery within 3 months (other than minor cosmetic surgery or minor dental procedures)
- Subject has received treatment with another investigational drug, or approved therapy for investigational use within 1 month prior to Day 1, or if the half-life of the previous product is known, within 5 times the half-life prior to Day 1, whichever is longer
